## clickSelector() function

Clicks an element address ed by a query selector atomically, e.g. within the same event loop run as finding it.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function clickSelector(page: PentfPage, selector: string, { timeout, checkEvery, message, visible, assertSuccess, retryUntil }?: TimeoutOptions & RetryOptions & VisibleOption & CheckEveryOption): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  page | [PentfPage](./pentf.pentfpage.md) | puppeteer page object. |
|  selector | string | \[CSS selector\](https://www.w3.org/TR/2018/REC-selectors-3-20181106/\#selectors) (aka query selector) of the targeted element. |
|  { timeout, checkEvery, message, visible, assertSuccess, retryUntil } | [TimeoutOptions](./pentf.timeoutoptions.md) &amp; [RetryOptions](./pentf.retryoptions.md) &amp; [VisibleOption](./pentf.visibleoption.md) &amp; [CheckEveryOption](./pentf.checkeveryoption.md) |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;

## Example


```javascript
await clickSelector(page, 'div[data-id="foo"] a.view', {message: 'Could not click foo link'});

```
